title: Mass Burial in Tournai Image MCQ 2

content.description:
ILLUSTRATION IN A CHRONICLE DEPICTING A MASS BURIAL IN THE CITY OF TOURNAI, LOCATED IN MODERN BELGIUM, CIRCA 1349

Photo 12 / Contributor Getty Images
content.question: Which of the following best explains why, in the mid fourteenth century, events of the type depicted in the image were more common in urban areas of Afro-Eurasia than in rural or mountainous regions?

choices.label: The disease principally spread along trade routes, and most commerce occurred in urban areas.
People in rural and mountainous regions had greater access to natural medicines that could fight the disease.
People in rural and mountainous regions were better able to flee to the safety of their lordsâ€™ castles.
The disease principally spread among religious missionaries, and most missionaries traveled to cities.

content.answer: The disease principally spread along trade routes, and most commerce occurred in urban areas.
